meanings.definition: In a shabby or untidy manner.
meanings.sent1: She dressed tattily for the party, with mismatched socks and wrinkled shirt.
meanings.sent2: The old house was decorated tattily with faded curtains and chipped furniture.
meanings.sent3: Despite her best efforts, her room always ended up looking tattily cluttered.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned building stood tattily on the corner, a shadow of its former self.
meanings.sent5: The garden was tattily overgrown, with weeds taking over every corner.

meanings.sent1: The homeless man sat on the bench in a tattily patched jacket.
meanings.sent2: She felt self-conscious in her tattily frayed jeans among the well-dressed crowd.
meanings.sent3: The costume party required guests to dress tattily, so she wore her oldest clothes.
meanings.sent4: The scarecrow in the field looked tattily dressed in old rags and straw hat.
meanings.sent5: The children's tattily torn costumes added to the charm of the school play.
